attributes.action: Get income generated from renting a room out to be included in the mortgage borrowing calculation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A “Flatmate mortgage” is a mortgage that takes into account the income generated from renting out a room when a lender calculates how much people can borrow to buy a house.  

Easyroommate is campaigning to get the mortgage industry and the government to make these sorts of mortgages available to hard-pressed UK borrowers.

Who and how will this help?

• 1st buyers will be able to borrow more, helping them get a foot on the ladder
• People facing financial difficulties will be able to remortgage onto these products allowing them to keep living in their home rather than being thrown out onto the street
• Renters will have more rooms available offering a greater or cheaper housing alternatives – it’s a great solution to the UK’s housing crisis

Why there’s a problem?

• The average age of a 1st buyer who isn’t getting money from their relatives, is now 37!
• Houses prices rose for 7 months in a row in Feb 2010 and are 9.9%+ than April 2009
• Unemployment rises and pay increases fail to keep up with rising prices
• 67% of lenders expect to see a rise in repossessions in 2010
• A record 4.5m people are already on waiting lists for affordable housing
